text: Many packages, especially C extensions, seem to build their `__all__` globals using augmented assignment or other dynamic methods.  Since understanding dynamic list creation in the general case is probably too hard, it would be more accurate to ignore `__all__` and simply assume that all public names are available from a wildcard import.
title: Remove `__all__` handling from import analysis
